Package com.example.recipeoop_1.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.controller.AuthController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
Controller responsible for handling user authentication.

This controller provides an endpoint for users to log in by submitting their credentials (username and password). Upon successful authentication, it returns a JSON Web Token (JWT) that can be used to access protected resources. The base path for authentication endpoints is /api/auth.

Since:
2025-05-14

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthController

      @Autowired public AuthController(org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationManager authenticationManager, JwtTokenUtil jwtTokenUtil, @Qualifier("jwtUserDetailsService") org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService userDetailsService)
      Constructs an AuthController with necessary dependencies for authentication.
      Parameters:
      authenticationManager - The Spring Security AuthenticationManager for processing authentication requests.
      jwtTokenUtil - Utility class (JwtTokenUtil) for generating and validating JWT tokens.
      userDetailsService - Service (UserDetailsService) for loading user-specific data, qualified with "jwtUserDetailsService" to specify the bean.

  • Method Details

    • createAuthenticationToken

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createAuthenticationToken(@RequestBody AuthController.JwtRequest authenticationRequest)
      Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token upon successful authentication.

      This endpoint expects a POST request to /api/auth/login with a JSON body containing the user's username and password.

      HTTP Method: POST Path: /api/auth/login

      Request Body: 

      
 {
 "username": "user_example",
 "password": "password_example"
 }
      (See AuthController.JwtRequest for details on the request structure)

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Authentication successful. Returns a AuthController.JwtResponse containing the JWT token. 
        
 {
 "token": "generated_jwt_token_string"
 }
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is disabled (DisabledException) or if credentials are invalid (BadCredentialsException). The response body will contain a specific error message.
      • 500 Internal Server Error: If any other unexpected error occurs during authentication. The response body will contain a generic error message.
      Parameters:
      authenticationRequest - A AuthController.JwtRequest object containing the username and password from the request body.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a AuthController.JwtResponse with the token on success, or an error message and appropriate HTTP status on failure.
      See Also:
      • AuthController.JwtRequest
      • AuthController.JwtResponse
      • JwtTokenUtil.generateToken(UserDetails)
      • UserDetailsService.loadUserByUsername(String)
      • AuthenticationManager.authenticate(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication)
